Package main.java.org.skloch.game

Class HustleGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.Game
      • main.java.org.skloch.game.HustleGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
    public class HustleGame
extends com.badlogic.gdx.Game
    A class that is initially created by DesktopLauncher, loads consistent files at the start of the game and initialises lots of important classes. Loads the map, ui skin, text files and makes sound manager and more

    • Constructor Detail

      • HustleGame

        public HustleGame​(int width,
                  int height)
        A class to initialise a lot of the assets required for the game, including the map, sound and UI skin. An instance of this object should be shared to most screens to allow resources to be shared and disposed of correctly. Should be created in DesktopLauncher,
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the window
        height - Height of the window

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create()
        Loads resources used throughout the game. Creates a new spritebatch Loads the UI skin to use Loads the map and configures which layers are background, foreground and object layers Loads a shape renderer for debug options Loads a sound manager to play sounds Loads credit and tutorial texts Creates a stage with a blue background for screens to use

      • switchToTownMap

        public void switchToTownMap()
        Switches the current map to town

      • switchToEastMap

        public void switchToEastMap()
        Switches the current map to east campus

        public com.badlogic.gdx.maps.tiled.TiledMap getMap()

      • render

        public void render()
        Very important, renders the game, remove super.render() to get a black screen
        Specified by:
        render in interface com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
        Overrides:
        render in class com.badlogic.gdx.Game

        public java.lang.String readTextFile​(java.lang.String filepath)
        Reads and returns text read from the provided text file path
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The contents of the file as a String

      • addPlayerToLeaderboard

        public void addPlayerToLeaderboard​(java.lang.String name,
                                   int score,
                                   boolean writeToFile)
        Adds a player to the leaderboard. This stores their name and score. Optionally, the leaderboard can be exported to a file once the player has been added.
        Parameters:
        name - - The name of the player to add
        score - - The score the player was given
        writeToFile - - boolean to decide if the leaderboard should be exported

      • clearLeaderboard

        public void clearLeaderboard()
        Clears the leaderboard

      • writeLeaderboardJSON

        public void writeLeaderboardJSON​(java.lang.String filepath)
        Exports the current leaderboard to a given file.
        Parameters:
        filepath - - The path of the file to export to

      • parseLeaderboardJSON

        public java.lang.String[][] parseLeaderboardJSON​(java.lang.String filepath)
        Reads and parses a JSON file to extract leaderboard data
        Parameters:
        filepath - The given file to read
        Returns:
        A leaderboard in the forms of a array of string arrays.
